item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 艾伦·凯：预测未来（Predicting The Future） in the user temberature at 2022-05-19T05:35:39
item.description:
in reference to:

在一些数学和科学课程中，他们经常告诉你，最好的方法是改变问题。我认为最好的方法是改变问题陈述的背景。几年前，马文·明斯基说，“你只有通过多种方式才能理解一件事。”（You don’t understand something until you understand it more than one way.）

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 阅读的未来取决于学习难学东西的未来（艾伦·凯） in the user temberature at 2022-05-19T06:06:24
item.description:
in reference to:

item.description:
in reference to:

人类医学史上第一个真正意义上的对照临床试验。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 中医这件事 in the user temberature at 2022-06-25T14:16:37
item.description:
in reference to:

对照试验只是一个开始，后来随着安慰剂效应的发现，盲测成为检验疗效另一个强大武器。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 中医这件事 in the user temberature at 2022-06-25T14:17:45
item.description:
in reference to:

所以后来索性把医生的眼睛也蒙起来——不告诉医疗人员哪组是安慰剂组哪组是实验组，所有的结果由第三方机构去统计和评判，这就是双盲对照实验。这种测试最大限度地排除了病人的安慰剂效应和医生的主观偏好，成为了判断药物客观疗效最有力的证据，现代医学的“金标准”。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:23:28
item.description:
in reference to:

The two core features I need are spaced repetition and bi-directional linking.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:34:26
item.description:
in reference to:

Linking makes the thinking process tangible: links are the proofs that you’ve connected the material with your prior knowledge. Having a lot of unlinked notes is also proof that different pieces of information exist in isolation.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:35:57
item.description:
in reference to:

But here’s the catch: the connection doesn’t happen automatically. You still have to intentionally and consciously think about the big picture to improve your understanding.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:44:26
item.description:
in reference to:

From now on, my focus on “how to learn” would be shifted from “when should I review this” to “what should I do when I indeed review this?” It’ll be about thinking frameworks and mental models; it’s about “what and how to think” instead of “when to think.”

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.description:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 游牧教室的文具盒：为何真正的学习是舒适的 in the user temberature at 2022-08-17T03:15:15
item.description:
in reference to:

此时的游牧教室，几乎变成了一层套一层的叠加小宇宙。最内层是学生的头脑。包裹着它的，是我们的对话（以及白板互动）。在这一层对话之外，是我的头脑（其中有无数可能突然才想起来的事例、材料，以及数字卡片资料）。而在我的物质身体之外是书库中无数的书架。

item.description:
in reference to:

反观美国，早在2017年就有90%的中小学实现了iPad辅助教学，纽约等州还推出了"1:1 iPad"（学生人手一台平板）的计划。此外，还有Google Chromebook这个现象级产品，仅仅2020年的发货量就达到了3000万台，其中绝大部分用于教育。在美国，大学生用Macbook、中小学生用Chromebook、大家都用iPad或Surface，早已成为司空见惯的常态。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Automating Read It Later Articles to DEVONthink - GeekDad in the user temberature at 2022-08-27T04:50:54
item.description:
in reference to:

So when you see something you want to dive into later when you have a bit more time… you have to put it somewhere. That is where a “read-it-later” service like Pocket or Instapaper comes in. Basic features with these services are free, but if you want more advanced features like “search” you have to pay. In the case of Pocket, it will cost you $4.99 a month or $44.99 a year to keep a permanent library of saved articles and be able to search the content of those articles.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Automating Read It Later Articles to DEVONthink - GeekDad in the user temberature at 2022-08-27T04:51:38
item.description:
in reference to:

Then many months later I will need to do something related to “that article I read a while back” and I have no way to find it. That is where DEVONthink comes in.

item.description:
in reference to:

It was shared 300,000 times on Facebook, made the front page of Reddit and became a trending topic on 4chan

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated At What Age Does Our Ability to Learn a New Language Like a Native Speaker Disappear? in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T03:03:33
item.description:
in reference to:

In what could be the most surprising conclusion, the researchers say that even among native speakers it takes 30 years to fully master a language. The study showed a slight improvement—roughly one percentage point—in people who have been speaking English for 30 versus 20 years. The finding is consistent for both native and non-native speakers.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How long does it take to master a language like a native speaker? in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T03:10:21
item.description:
in reference to:

I find that memorizing a number of ‘filler’ words or sentences can greatly increase your ability to come off as native, as well as knowing some expressions and sayings. Instead of expressing agreement with a simple ‘yes’ you could try responding with “you know what? I Agree!” or “I think I see what you mean”. It’s agreement either way but it sounds a lot more ‘native’.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 面向白嫖(Baipiao-oriented)的DevOps：将定时更新任务扔给Github Actions去做 - 阅读清单 - 腾讯云开发者社区-腾讯云 in the user temberature at 2022-09-03T07:24:06

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Folder Structure to Maximize Writing with Devonthink Pro — Workflows in Personal and Professional Productivity in the user temberature at 2022-09-03T14:29:11
item.description:
in reference to:

Although at one point I had all my information on manuscripts in a single DTP database, over the last year I have maintained separate databases; one for PDFs, another for my annotations.I accomplish this by having separate folders in Dropbox. After extracting my annotations from Highlights.app, I place the exported files in their own folder. Once a month, I export all the PDFs in my Paper’s Library to their own Dropbox folder. I use a Hazel script to throw away any duplicate PDFs in the Dropbox folder. I index (not import) the annotations folder into one DTP database, and index my PDFs into another.

item.description:
in reference to:

My Bookends library is indexed in DEVONthink. I have a script that automatically creates a custom metadata field in DEVONthink for the Bookends ID, and puts the DEVONthink UID for that same record in the Bookends user20 field. You can then query the Bookends and DEVONthink databases together via AppleScript.

item.description:
in reference to:

Depending on your use case, it may be easier to create an external tool that uses the Web API to access Zotero libraries, read from (not write to!) the Zotero client's SQLite database, run ad hoc JavaScript within Zotero, or interact with one of the other APIs that the Zotero client exposes (e.g., for word processor integration).

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated retrieve_pdf_metadata [Zotero Documentation] in the user temberature at 2022-09-04T17:33:54
item.description:
in reference to:

To use this feature, simply drag your existing PDFs into your Zotero library or use the “Store Copy of File” or “Link to File” options from the add new item menu (green plus sign). By default, Zotero will automatically retrieve metadata for each PDF, create an appropriate parent item, and rename the associated file based on the metadata. (You can disable these automatic functions in the General pane of Zotero preferences.)

temberature@hypothes.is said:
